search_results.lyrics:
Above the Salt Lyrics[Verse 1: Portair]
I’ve been waiting for a tonic
To blunt the blow of what’s been coming
I’ve made my peace with being honest
Letting you know
Letting you know

I tell myself it just felt right
Walking off into the night
If what I’m feeling isn’t spite
How can I know?
How can I know?
[Pre-Chorus: Portair]
I’ve found myself above the salt
A better man with better faults
Burning blades of weathered grass
Wringing out my weathered hands

[Chorus: Portair]
I’ve been waiting
For someone you won’t become
Anticipating
The quiet before the rush

I’ve been chasing
A feeling that nevеr comes
I’ve been waiting
For someonе you won’t become

[Verse 2: VÉRITÉ]
I’ve been sipping gin and tonics
To numb the hits as they keep coming
I hit the floor and you keep running
Don’t know how to end or where we started, no

I told myself that we’d grow old
Like purple palms braced for the cold
I tried and tried but I can’t let go
It’s like I hold on for the principle, hey
You might also like[Pre-Chorus: VÉRITÉ]
I’ve found myself above the salt
Better 'cause I know my faults
Burning blades of weathered grass
A forest fire from my hands

[Chorus: Portair & VÉRITÉ]
I’ve been waiting
For someone you won’t become
Anticipating
The quiet before the rush

I’ve been chasing
A feeling that never comes
I’ve been waiting
For someone you won’t become

[Bridge: Portair & VÉRITÉ, both]
Idling on the fringe
Staring at the sun
Looking back at where I’ve been
And how I can become

Water sitting on the skin
Sulfur in the cut
Learning how to let it go
Idling on the fringe
Staring at the sun
Looking back at where I’ve been
And who I can become

Water sitting on the skin
Sulfur in the cut
Learning how to let it go

[Chorus: Portair & VÉRITÉ]
I’ve been waiting
For someone you won’t become
Anticipating
The quiet before the rush

I’ve been chasing
A feeling that never comes
I’ve been waiting
For someone you won’t becomeEmbed

description.plain:
“Somebody Else” originally premiered on the radio on February 15, 2016 as the fourth single from The 1975’s second official studio album, I like it when you sleep, for you are so beautiful yet so unaware of it.

“I am a big fan of The 1975’s vision, aesthetic and how effective their writing is,” she mentioned with the premiere of the song. “‘Somebody Else’ is so simple, relatable and well written. I really wanted to take it into my world and reinterpret it a bit."

body.plain:
“Somebody Else” originally premiered on the radio on February 15, 2016 as the fourth single from The 1975’s second official studio album, I like it when you sleep, for you are so beautiful yet so unaware of it.

“I am a big fan of The 1975’s vision, aesthetic and how effective their writing is,” she mentioned with the premiere of the song. “‘Somebody Else’ is so simple, relatable and well written. I really wanted to take it into my world and reinterpret it a bit."

annotations:
I’m looking through you while you’re looking through your phone
 And leaving with somebody else
She’s looking through them, looking at them, but they aren’t really present, because they’re communicating with her replacement.

I’m looking through you while you’re looking through your phone
 And leaving with somebody else
 No I don’t want your body
 But I hate to think about you with somebody else
She’s looking through them, looking at them, but they aren’t really present, because they’re communicating with her replacement.

I don’t want your body
 But I hate to think about you with somebody else
 A love gone cold
 You’re intertwining your soul with somebody else
She doesn’t necessarily want them anymore, as a result of what they’ve done to her, and she understands that they are no longer in love. But despite this she isn’t ready to give them up.

Come on, baby
 This ain’t the last time that I’ll see your face
 Come on, baby
 You said you’d find someone to take my place
 Oh I don’t believe that you have got it in you
 Cause we are just gonna keep doin’ it and every time
 I start to believe in anything you’re sayin’
 I’m reminded that I should be gettin’ over it

The songwriter pleads with their partner, saying that they dont think anything will really change, and it’s just another fight. But the more they talk the more the songwriter is reminded that their time would be better spent focusing on something new rather than dwelling on the past.

I’m looking through you while you’re looking through your phone
 And leaving with somebody else
 No I don’t want your body
 But I hate to think about you with somebody else
She’s looking through them, looking at them, but they aren’t really present, because they’re communicating with her replacement.

I don’t want your body
 But I hate to think about you with somebody else
 A love gone cold
 You’re intertwining your soul with somebody else
She doesn’t necessarily want them anymore, as a result of what they’ve done to her, and she understands that they are no longer in love. But despite this she isn’t ready to give them up.

So I heard you found somebody else
 And at first I thought it was a lie
 So I took all my things that make sounds
 And the rest I can do without

When the narrator first heard of the infidelity—which most likely occurred while he was away on tour—he experienced the first of the five stages of grief: denial. His immediate instinct was to defend the girl he loved, therefore instantly believing she was incapable of committing such a terrible act.

However, the narrator eventually moved onto the fifth stage of grief: acceptance. He realizes that there is no longer any love left in the now terminal relationship, and leaves.



[From the original song]

description.plain: On “new skin”, VERITE slowly draws us into her world she’s created of airy synths and dreamy vocals on the title track. The words in steady repetition almost read as an omen to herself and listeners, greeting but also warning them both of the good and bad that could come when you mix love with lust.

I thought I was waiting for you to slow your ride

You said you'd take me anywhere I'd like

Thou-thou-thought I was waiting

Thou-thou-thought I was waiting for you

search_results.title: ​love you forever
search_results.lyrics:
​love you forever Lyrics[Verse 1]
Did you know when you started
Watching me like a television
On-demand in the palm of your hand?
You would leave and turn me off
I'm a little bit nauseous
'Cause you fucked off one night
And now that I have opened my eyes
The morning light feels awful

[Verse 2]
You're too good at driving your car
Fast down the hill, and pulling the brakes
Quick with your silence
Saying that you don't know how to feel
Can't talk to my face, so you got off the ride
To find your peace and quiet
[Chorus]
I didn't want to get married
But I could've loved you forever
I knew when we started
The end was inevitable
You're a little bit selfish
And I know we'll be better off

[Verse 3]
Why am I like this when you
Can't pay rent, getting drunk with your friends
Buried head in the sand? You're a little bit childish
You're always saying how
I'm too upset, need to learn how to rest
Make up stories in my head, but I can't help that
When you walk away it feels like violence

[Chorus]
I didn't want to get married
But I could've loved you forever
I knew when we started
The end was inevitable
I'm a little bit angry
But I know that we're better off

[Bridge]
I should've known by now
You're so weak you'd kick me in the teeth
Before you leave to make yourself feel better off
And I'm still like this 'cause
Your exit's playing on repeat
Like you're still here and I can't sleep
With you dancing on my eyelids
You might also like[Chorus]
I didn't want to get married
But I could've loved you forever
I knew when we started
The end was inevitable
You're a little dishonest
And I know I'll be better off

[Outro]
'Cause now I'm just someone
You wish would just let goEmbed

description.plain:
From https://dustyorgan.com/2022/10/31/indie-pop-artist-verite-shares-heartbreaking-new-single-love-you-forever/:

A beautifully stripped track, the focus remains on VÉRITÉ’s clean vocals, a steady mix of percussion beats and strummed guitar guiding the track, joined by strings in the latter half to emphasize the build of emotion captured in the lyrics. Signing about heartbreak, the crash of a relationship meant to last forever, the crescendo as the song nears its close mirrors the feeling of the impending end of the relationship.

Speaking to the track, VÉRITÉ shares: “It’s rare I write from my experience this literally, but I was heartbroken and angry and felt torn between knowing the end of something is the correct thing and not wanting to let it go…”

The music video captures the feeling of being alone in a partnership effortlessly, as the two figures dance in their living room, close together, though one’s face is concealed and clearly already removed.

About the song’s origins, VÉRITÉ says that the track “was written on my couch fervently typing lyrics into my notes app and trying to fit words into sensible melodic phrases while crying. I didn’t record a voice memo or sit down at a piano, I just walked around for a few weeks sitting in the feeling, singing and arranging it in my brain until I brought the idea into the studio and spent the day bending the tempo of the song to push and pull to mimic the tension I felt in my own body. I love capturing something raw and not overproducing it, not hiding under sheen, but exposing the intricate inner workings to truly capture a feeling.”

song.title: ​love you forever

body.plain:
From https://dustyorgan.com/2022/10/31/indie-pop-artist-verite-shares-heartbreaking-new-single-love-you-forever/:

A beautifully stripped track, the focus remains on VÉRITÉ’s clean vocals, a steady mix of percussion beats and strummed guitar guiding the track, joined by strings in the latter half to emphasize the build of emotion captured in the lyrics. Signing about heartbreak, the crash of a relationship meant to last forever, the crescendo as the song nears its close mirrors the feeling of the impending end of the relationship.

Speaking to the track, VÉRITÉ shares: “It’s rare I write from my experience this literally, but I was heartbroken and angry and felt torn between knowing the end of something is the correct thing and not wanting to let it go…”

The music video captures the feeling of being alone in a partnership effortlessly, as the two figures dance in their living room, close together, though one’s face is concealed and clearly already removed.

About the song’s origins, VÉRITÉ says that the track “was written on my couch fervently typing lyrics into my notes app and trying to fit words into sensible melodic phrases while crying. I didn’t record a voice memo or sit down at a piano, I just walked around for a few weeks sitting in the feeling, singing and arranging it in my brain until I brought the idea into the studio and spent the day bending the tempo of the song to push and pull to mimic the tension I felt in my own body. I love capturing something raw and not overproducing it, not hiding under sheen, but exposing the intricate inner workings to truly capture a feeling.”

​a lucid dream Lyrics[Verse 1]
You look prettier in this light
I prefer you in the background of an empty sky
A body in the basement of a former life
An anecdote I share to give some insight

[Pre-Chorus]
But now I can't escape the heat of July or its humidity
And I don’t miss the taste of you 'cause it's escaped my memory
I know you started off sweet before you got bitter
And I could tell it as a lie or I could say what it is now
[Chorus]
Maybe you’re a lucid dream
I tried to keep locked up in my mind
But you're just another casualty
I tried to leave buried in the yard
The grass under my feet, you blend into the scenery
'Til you're growing flowers on my lawn
Maybe you're a lucid dream
And I'm losing sleep tryna get back to my heart
Close my eyes and take me to the start

We were better out of context
A momentary lapse that killed my common sense
Some attention that I got to build my confidence
I'm a sacrifice you made to your God complex

Taste of you, 'cause it's escaped my memory
